plugins.name: Paste Data
plugins.description:
🧩 Paste CSV into Text Layers

Paste tabular data directly into selected Figma text layers. Supports Excel or CSV data, auto-detects rows or columns, and applies values instantly.


🧠 Smart paste detection: one row = horizontal; multiple rows = vertical

💡 Works with grouped/frames/nested selections

⚡ Designed for quick content updates and data-driven designs
plugins.tagline: Paste Multiple Rows and Columns of Data into Table Cells

plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed
plugins.tagline: 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.name: Quick Layout Calculator
plugins.description: Constantly reveal spacing between elements in your designs with clear, red labels showing exact pixel measurements. Perfect for design system maintainers and UI developers who need quick spacing verification without manual guides. Select a frame, click "Show Spacing" to display distances, and "Hide Spacing" to remove them. Works with all layer types and keeps your design clean by focusing on nearby elements.

plugins.description: 此插件旨在帮助设计师和开发者快速高效地将 Figma 中的设计内容无缝迁移到我们的内部系统 CDS（Content Delivery System）。通过简单易用的操作界面，您可以轻松导出设计文件、组件和图层，并确保所有数据在 CDS 中正确存储和管理，从而提高工作流程的效率，减少重复劳动。适用于需要在多平台间协同工作的团队，助力项目的快速迭代和交付。

plugins.name: Quick Variant
plugins.description:
Allows designers to quickly cycle through component variants for selected instances. With simple commands, you can switch to the next or previous variant of a component, streamlining your design workflow.


Key features


  1. Rapidly explore different component states without manual swapping
  2. Efficiently test various design options in context
  3. Seamlessly navigate complex component sets
  4. Boost productivity when working with design systems


Perfect for designers who frequently work with component variants and want to speed up their iteration process.
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to swap variants of components

plugins.name: PrinTriX (Precise CMYK Color Suite)
plugins.description:
PrinTriX is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of print-ready PDFs, ensuring your design exports consistently reflect your brand guidelines.

Whether you're working on marketing materials, packaging, or brand assets, PrinTriX allows designers to confidently transition from digital design to high-quality print. By supporting advanced features like color profile control, frame selection, and DPI adjustments, the plugin gives teams the precision and flexibility needed to meet even the most demanding print standards. With PrinTriX, maintaining visual consistency across all printed media becomes simple, reliable, and efficient—right from within Figma.

  1. Fine-tune colors with color palette feature that maps RGB colors to your desired CMYK color
  2. Select and organize only the frames you need
  3. Control DPI to balance print quality with file size.
  4. Export Designs to CMYK/Grayscale/RGB print-ready PDFs.
plugins.tagline: CMYK, Print, ColorProfile, PDF, Export, DPI, Bleed

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: Move to Origin
plugins.description:
Move to Origin is a simple utility plugin that positions your selected elements so that the topmost and leftmost element sits precisely at coordinates (0,0).


Instructions

1. Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas

2. Run the "Move to Origin" plugin from the Plugins menu

3. Your selection will instantly move so the topmost-leftmost element is at (0,0)


Key features:

  1. One-click positioning to origin point (0,0)
  2. Maintains relative spacing between all selected elements
  3. Works with any number of selected objects
  4. No UI — just select and run


Perfect for:

  1. Cleaning up artboard layouts
  2. Preparing elements for export
  3. Standardizing component positions
  4. Aligning multiple elements to a predictable starting point


Simply select the elements you want to reposition, run the plugin, and watch as your selection snaps to the origin while preserving the spatial relationships between all elements.


Save time and maintain precision in your designs with this essential positioning tool.
plugins.tagline: Instantly align your selection to (0,0) while preserving relative positions between elements.

plugins.name: xps.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import XPS documents (.xps and .oxps)
plugins.description:
Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs.


Convert any XPS document into Figma designs. Import your XPS into Figma as designs with fully editable text layers, or as static, pixel-perfect images.


How to import XPS documents into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, xps.to.design
  2. Upload your file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your document will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use xps.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your XPSs and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Collaborate on XPS documents with your team in Figma.
  3. Use XPS as templates for new designs in Figma.
  4. And much more!


FREE

  1. 5 imports
  2. Imports as editable layers: First 3 pages only


PRO License

  1. Full features, multiple files at once and unlimited imports
  2. $49 for 1-year (not recurring)

or

  1. $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.tagline: Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: FigCrawl
plugins.description:
FigCrawl: Your FigJam Content Extractor


What is FigCrawl?

FigCrawl is a powerful FigJam plugin that transforms your collaborative boards into structured, AI-ready data. It intelligently extracts and organizes all your board's content while preserving the visual hierarchy and relationships between elements.


Use Cases

For Designers & Teams

  1. Extract structured content from brainstorming sessions
  2. Convert visual collaboration into actionable data
  3. Document and archive board content
  4. Share board content in a structured format


For AI/LLM Integration

  1. Feed board content into AI tools
  2. Generate summaries and reports
  3. Analyze relationships between ideas
  4. Create structured documentation


For Documentation

  1. Export board content for documentation
  2. Create structured reports
  3. Archive important board sessions
  4. Share insights with stakeholders



How It Works

  1. Launch: Open the plugin in your FigJam board
  2. Extract: Click "Extract Content" to scan your board
  3. Review: See a summary of extracted content
  4. Copy: Choose to copy the entire board or individual pages
  5. Use: Paste the JSON into your preferred AI tool or LLM
plugins.tagline: Extract FigJam content into AI-ready data with one click

plugins.name: OS converter
plugins.description:
Stop duplicating your work! Convert entire flows or single frames between iOS and Android in seconds — no more tedious manual adjustments.


Why OS Converter?

Designers are often faced with a choice:

  1. Design in one OS and leave conversions to developers
  2. Manually recreate each flow for both platforms


With OS Converter, you get the best of both worlds — fast, accurate, and hassle-free conversion.


How it works:

  1. Set up your components – Use a variant property named "OS" with values "iOS" and "Android"
  2. Run the plugin – When your layouts are ready to convert
  3. Click to swap! – Convert single frames or entire flows in one click
  4. 🎨 See it in action! Check out the sample file below.
plugins.tagline: Swap single frames or entire flows between iOS and Android in seconds!

plugins.name: Private Notes
plugins.description:
Private Notes allows you to attach personal annotations to any layer in your Figma file that remain completely private to you.


  1. Truly Private: Notes are stored locally and their contents are only visible to you, never to other collaborators
  2. Visual Markers: Customisable markers show where you've left notes (only visible when you run the plugin)
  3. Flexible Positioning: Place note markers in 8 different positions around your layers that stay fixed to the right frame.
  4. Persistent Storage: Your notes remain attached to layers even when you close and reopen Figma


Perfect for designers who want to keep track of personal thoughts, reminders, and to-dos without cluttering the file with comments visible to everyone.


Use it for recording client feedback, noting implementation details, or leaving yourself breadcrumbs for areas that need further attention.


Please contact me for any feedback. suggestions or issues!
plugins.tagline: Keep your thoughts private- annotations only you can see.

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
110619.description:

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.

plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer’s name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic 😉)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix “exclude-” to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


💬 Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I’d love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
👋 Hi! 
I’m, a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.tagline: JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into JSON data.

plugins.name: ARBFromDesign
plugins.description: Streamline your localization workflow with the ARBFromDesign plugin for Figma. This tool automatically extracts text from your Figma frames and generates ARB (Application Resource Bundle) entries in camelCase format, ready for translation. The plugin intelligently excludes date and time formats, ensuring clean and accurate entries. With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Generate ARB Entries from Your Figma Designs

108296.name: ARBFromDesign

The plugin intelligently excludes date and time formats, ensuring clean and accurate entries. With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.

  1. Pick colours and create colour palettes, either using the plugin's colour picker, or from existing colours in your project
  2. Generate shades from any colour, choosing one ad-hoc or from existing styles in your project
  3. Copy code snippets for software development on web and Android, making it easier for you to add colours to CSS (including preprocessors), Android (including XML and Jetpack Compose)

More information here.

plugins.name: Alt Text Generator
plugins.description:
Overview

Generate alt text for images using AI. Improve SEO and accessibility for your websites and rank higher on Google.


Benefits

Automatic: Alt text is automatically added to every image on the site using bulk feature.


Free Credits: Get 5 free credits upon sign up.


Extensive Image Support: Supports the following image types: JPEG, JPG, PNG, GIF, and WEBP.


SEO and Accessibility: Alt text generated is highly optimized to rank higher and improve SEO.


Features

Generate alt text using AI - Use AI to automatically generate alt text for your images.


Bulk generate - Automatically detects all images on site editor and adds alt text.


How It Works

Open plugin.


Get a free API key from https://alttextgeneratorai.com/dashboard


(5 free credits upon sign up)


Start generating alt text for free.


Done!


Credits

The plugin works based on credits. You get 5 free credits upon sign up. If you need to recharge credits, you can visit our pricing page.


Pricing

We don't like monthly plans, so all of our plans are one-time payment plans and affordable to all users.
plugins.tagline: Generate alt text for images using AI

plugins.name: Variant Multi-Selector
plugins.description:
Tired of manually selecting variant properties one by one?


Variant Multi-Selector solves this by allowing you to multi-select multiple properties and values together — and instantly filter, edit, and manage matching variants inside your component set! 🚀


✨ Key Features:

•Select multiple properties (like Size, State, Type) at once

•Apply filters and select matching variants instantly

•View bound variables attached to your variants (Figma Variables integration!)

•Designed for fast, large-scale Design System workflows


🔥 Perfect for:

•Design system builders

•Product designers managing large variant sets

•UI/UX designers who want to speed up Figma workflows


🙏 Built with love and real-world design pain.
plugins.tagline: Select and edit multiple variant properties at once.

plugins.name: Translate Text with Gemini
plugins.description:
Translate Text with Gemini is a powerful yet lightweight Figma plugin that helps you quickly translate any selected text nodes into over 30 languages using Google’s Gemini AI.


✨ Key Features:

•Supports App Store Connect languages (e.g. French, Japanese, Arabic, Vietnamese, etc.)

•Smart deduplication — identical phrases are only translated once

•Structured output parsing to ensure accurate mapping

•Custom language support beyond the dropdown list

•Built for speed and scale (bulk translate entire Frames/Sections)


🔒 Your API key is safely stored per session.


Created with ❤️ by Giang Nguyen.
plugins.tagline: Effortless multilingual translation for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Latin ⇄ Cyrillic
plugins.description:
Instantly flip any text layer—or whole frames—from Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.


🛠 How it works

• Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

• Run Plugins → “Latin ➜ Cyrillic” or “Cyrillic ➜ Latin”

• Fonts auto‑load, characters swap, you’re done


✨ Why it’s handy

• Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

• Handles digraphs (dž, lj, nj, dj) correctly

• Works inside components, variants, and instances

• Zero setup, zero UI—pure speed


⚠️ Limitations

• Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

• Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops
plugins.tagline: One‑click Serbian Latin ⇄ Cyrillic transliteration
